Title: State’s progress vital for nat’l devpt: NITI Ayog
Content: Guwahati: Prof Vinod Paul, member ofNITI Aayog, on Thursday said achieving a developed nation (âViksit Rashtra') necessitates the advancement of its states, positioning Assam's progress as a national priority.He emphasised Assam's untapped resources and its youthful demographic as vital assets for economic development, while speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the two-day workshop on "Viksit Assam@ 2047" organised by NITI Aayog in collaboration with Transformation and Development Department and State Innovation and Transformation Aayog, Assam, held in the city on Thursday.Prof Paul advocated for prioritising women's development to fosterinclusive growthand minimise disparities. He further emphasised the necessity of embracing emerging technologies, such as Artificial Intelligence, to enhance the state's educational and economic landscape.Dr O P Agarwal, distinguished fellow of NITI Aayog presented a comprehensive analysis of Assam's strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats as part of the state's roadmap for the future. His address highlighted the significance of identifying both challenges and opportunities to formulate a holistic, forward-looking development plan for Assam.This workshop endeavoured to foster dialogue and strategic planning for Assam's advancement, aligning with India's vision of becoming a developed nation by 2047.Ravi Kota, Chief Secretary, Govt. of Assam expressed that the Viksit Assam@2047 is not merely a roadmap but a collective commitment to establishing a prosperous, inclusive, and sustainable Assam. He emphasised that the vision is founded on the principles of equity, innovation, sustainability, and integrity, aiming to ensure that development benefits every citizen.Kota highlighted key areas of focus, including nurturing families through quality education, accessible healthcare, and living wages for all; fostering harmonious communities through community development, social justice, and environmental sustainability; and promoting a thriving economy by embracing advancements like Industrial Revolution 4.0, resilient smart agriculture, and effective governance.Neelam Patel, Project Director of Assam, NITI Aayog, delivered the opening remarks where Patel provided a detailed overview of Vision Assam 2047, highlighting the key objectives of this ambitious initiative.

Title: Every citizen must imbibe spirit of Constitution: Kerala governor
Content: T'puram: GovernorRajendra Vishwanath Arlekarsaid that the Constitution is the driving force of the country, and that the essence of the Constitution should be imbibed by every citizen of the country. He was speaking after inaugurating theJai Bhim Padyatraorganized by the Union ministry of youth affairs and spots and Nehru Yuva Kendra, as part of the 75th anniversary celebration of theConstitution of Indiaand the 134th birth anniversary of the architect of the Constitution,Dr BR Ambedkar, here on Sunday."The Constitution is the guiding force of the nation, and every citizen should internalise its essence. Ambedkar, the architect of the Constitution, called for serving the underprivileged and upholding their rights and emphasised that the nation should be given the highest priority and that no one is above the Constitution," the governor said.The Constitution continues to guide the functioning of the country's legislative, executive, and judicial systems. He said the Constitution should be understood not just through its written text, but through the spirit it embodies.The grand vision of a developed India by 2047, given to us by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, aligns with the idea of putting the nation first. The youth have a significant role in realising this goal, he said.Arlekar said that the padyatra reflects a collective commitment to what Dr Ambedkar stood for â the service of the downtrodden and the upliftment of the common people.

Title: Sickle cell anaemia awareness drive & screening for cadets
Content: Bhopal: NCC Group Headquarters Bhopal collaborated with theNational Health Mission(NHM) to conduct a screening and awareness drive on Wednesday. The campaign examined 60 cadets from different NCC units as part of the National Sickle Cell Anaemia Elimination Mission.The initiative, led by Capt Dr C B S Dangi, follows the successful screening of over 38,000 cadets across Madhya Pradesh during the 2024-25 training period.The programme focuses on early detection and awareness about Sickle Cell Anaemia and Thalassemia through educational sessions, with the objective of eliminating these conditions from India by 2047.Sickle Cell Disease(SCD), a hereditary condition, causes chronic anaemia, intense pain, stunted growth, and damage to vital organs including the heart, lungs, kidneys, and brain.Recent years showed an increased occurrence of this serious condition in Central India, necessitating comprehensive intervention strategies. Recognising the NCC's significant reach among youth, NCC Group Headquarters, Bhopal, joined forces with NHM in June 2024 to begin cadet screening across eight units during training periods. Following discussions between the NHM director and the ADG of NCC MP & CG directorate, the initiative expanded to include cadets from all five NCC Groups in MP.The programme prioritises awareness through educational sessions and discussions led by Dr Dangi at NCC training camps and institutions. He shared his knowledge at the Officers Training Academy (OTA), Kamptee, in March 2025, addressing trainee and refresher Associate NCC Officers.

Title: After launch of air service from Hisar airport, Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini hails ‘new era of connectivity’
Content: 12Hisar: Haryana chief minister Nayab Singh Saini on Monday hailed the launch of air services from Hisar'sMaharaja Agrasen Airportas the beginning of "a new direction, a new flight, and a new era" for the state.Speaking at the Sankalp Ki Udaan ceremony marking the start offlights to Ayodhyaand the foundation stone laying of Terminal-2, Saini credited the rapid progress to the "triple-engine govt" led by Prime Minister Narender Modi. The event coincided with the 135th birth anniversary of B R Ambedkar. The CM said: "This is a historic day for Hisar and Haryana. With direct flights to Ayodhya, Jammu, Ahmedabad, Jaipur, and Chandigarh, the state is stepping into a new phase of development."Saini praised Hisar as a land rich in heritage, hard work, and sacrifice, referencing Rakhigarhi's ancient civilisation and Agroha's commercial legacy. He said Haryana was actve contributor to PM's vision of a developed India by 2047. Recalling the PM's 2024 rally in Hisar, Saini said the BJP's third consecutive term in the state reflected public trust in its leadership and governance. He claimed the party to have fulfilled 19 of its manifesto promises within 100 days.

Title: Largest poultry conclave kicks off in city with 3000 traders
Content: Raipur: Over 3000 poultry traders from across the country have gathered at India'slargest poultryconclave being organized in Raipur as the event marked a significant push toward modernizing poultry practices and turning the state into the nation's leading âProtein Hub' by 2035.The conclave is being hosted by theIB Groupin Raipur. The group managing director BahadurAlilaid out the company's ambitious roadmap, aligning it with PM Narendra Modi's vision of a developed India by 2047."We're not just building a businessâwe're building a healthier India," Ali said, stressing the growing importance of chicken protein in the Indian diet. He highlighted the increasing demand for chicken protein in India, supported by both central and state govts."Just like in Europe and the USA, we are striving to make protein an everyday essential here in India," he said.One of the event's central themes was rural development. Ali said that an initiative to open a chicken protein shop for every 1,500 people, creating employment and boosting local income was in discussion.

Title: Gujarat now gateway to global economy: Amit Shah
Content: 1234Ahmedabad: Union home and cooperation ministerAmit Shahsaid Gujarat has become the gateway to theglobal economy. He said Gujarat is set to take the lead in new industries such as semiconductors andgreen energy. Gujarat chief minister Bhupendra Patel said Gujarat will become a $3.5 trillion economy by 2047 and contribute to making India a developed country.Addressing the inauguration of the Gujarat Chamber of Commerce and Industry's three-day trade expo at Science City virtually on Thursday, Shah said, "Gujarat has played an important role in making India the fifth largest economy in the world and now will have to contribute significantly to make India the third largest economy.""GCCI has played an important role in the economic development of the state. MSMEs are our biggest asset, and the GCCI should integrate them with startups to create a new ecosystem for youth," he said.Shah highlighted Gujarat's sustained industrial growth and the chamber's support for businesses over the past 75 years. Stressing the imperative for a forward-looking 25-year roadmap, he said there is a need to integrate Gujarat's extensive trading network with digital transactions and foster entrepreneurship among the youth. He also highlighted the importance of smart infrastructure, seamless interconnectivity and Gujarat's strategic advantage conferred by its extensive coastline."Entrepreneurs looking to establish industrial units in Gujarat are assured of a business-friendly environment free from political interference and supported by efficient systems and a strike-free atmosphere," he said.Gujarat chief minister Bhupendra Patel said Gujarat is the first state to have prepared a roadmap for 2047 with a vision of âEarning Well and Living Well'."The Aatmanirbhar Bharat and Make In India initiatives have helped the country become a manufacturing hub. Now global companies do not see India just as a huge market but also as a manufacturing hub," he said.Zydus Group chairman Pankaj Patel said GCCI is completing 75 years and the trade expo on this occasion will become a platform for stronger future growth.GCCI president Sandeep Engineer said, "Around 300 companies are participating in the expo and we have emphasized new-age emerging sectors. We expect around 15,000 people will visit the expo."

Title: Make India a developed country by 2047: CUSB VC
Content: 12Patna: Central University of South Bihar (CUSB)'s vice-chancellor (VC) Kameshwar Nath Singh on Tuesday emphasized the need to organizescientific workshopsat regular intervals so that the students may develop a clear concept of the latest equipment and its applications."The provisions of theNational Education Policy-2020will be properly implemented only when the academics are made to learn the basic know-how of all the modern technological innovations," he said.Inaugurating a state-level workshop on âdroplet-based digital PCRand its applications' organised by the life science department of CUSB, the VC called upon the university teachers to carry out detailed research on the problems faced by human beings and help develop the country into a modern society. "All efforts should be made tomake India a developed country by 2047," he said.PollDo you think the National Education Policy-2020 will positively impact technological education?NoYesAround 100 scholars from different departments of CUSB, Magadh University and L N Mithila University attended the workshop and gained experience in droplet generation, thermal cycling and analysing samples with droplet digital PCR.Life science department head Ram Pratap Singh and DST-Purse project coordinator Venketesh Singh explained the use of advanced instruments in biological research.
